messages.subject: the definition of "bashing"
messages.msgSnippet: I think literally, to bash is to create a concavity in something.  I could be wrong. There s a report that someone was bashed recently on my forum (meaning,
messages.messageBody:
I think literally, to bash is to create a concavity in something. I
could be wrong.

There's a report that someone was bashed recently on "my
forum" (meaning, I guess, SandraDodd.com) but I don't see how that
could be. I think some people call "bash" when anyone fails to coo
tea-party-like about their ideas.

Anyway, here's the report. I'm sure no one was treated this badly on
any forum I was in or involved with:

"KathyJo I just wanted to say I agree with you 100%. I happen to like
the term horseshit quite well. Very fitting actually. Have you ever
been over to Sandraï¿½s unschoolers forum? If not you really should go
check it out. A friend of mine sent me a link to it a couple of weeks
ago because she got completely bashed there for making a suggestiong
regarding healthy food. I thought that in this day and age nothing
could shock me. I was wrong. Horseshit on top of horseshit smoothered
in horseshit."

That's the final word on the forum from which I was banished, because
the blog owner has promised to delete any future comments.

Honestly, I think her whole attack on Zach's writings will backfire
for her and introduce dozens or maybe hundreds of people to peaceful
ideas they NEVER would've gotten from conservative blogs or church.
It couldn't possibly have made the blog author any friends (not
counting one or two who went there because they heard there was blood
and they like to be ringside at fights). I just don't feel like the
blood was any of mine, nor the horseshit either.

Sandra

[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
